author: Charlie Ridgely
title: Chris Pratt Reveals Which Netflix Characters He Wants To Work With
text:
Chris Pratt Reveals Which Netflix Characters He Wants To Work With Charlie Ridgely Start Photo Gallery Back to Article Image of Ever since the Marvel shows on Netflix became hits among fans, viewers have been dying to know if the characters will ever appear in the Cinematic Universe. The creative teams over at Marvel have been pretty mum about the whole thing, but they seem to downplay the idea when they're asked about it. For awhile, it has seemed like that crossover just isn't going to come to fruition. The actors however, would love to intertwine their worlds. Vincent D'Onofrio, who plays Kingpin on Daredevil , has expressed how much he'd love to work with the movie characters in the future. Apparently, Chris Prat t feels the same way. During a Guardians Of The Galaxy Vol. 2 set visit, Pratt was asked if there was any character he'd really like to work with. The actor quickly dropped two of the biggest names in the Marvel TV shows. "Yes! There’s so many! I don’t know what’s possible now that Marvel is under Disney and some Marvel characters are under different studios, some are in TV, and some are - I don’t know how it works - I think it would be awesome for Starlord to meet Vincent D’Onofrio’s Kingpin somehow. [Laughs] That would be awesome. I was always a fan of The Punisher. That was my dude who I loved growing up. I had the murals of him on my wall and stuff, so that would be pretty awesome. Maybe a little more moody than Quill. I don’t know exactly how they would work together." The interviewer immediately joked that this meant a Guardians/Defenders crossover was in the works, and Chris laughed along with them. "Hey, I feel like we can do that nowadays, right? Look, I’m clearly not responsible for making any of these decisions. I’ll kinda do anything they want me to do."

Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2 is written and directed by James Gunn (Slither). The film marks the return of the original Guardians, including Chris Pratt (Jurassic World) as Peter Quill/Star-Lord; ZoeSaldana (Star Trek Into Darkness) as Gamora ; Dave Bautista (Spectre) as Drax ; Vin Diesel (Furious 7) as the voice of Groot ; Bradley Cooper (American Sniper) as the voice of Rocket; Michael Rooker (Jumper) as Yondu ; Karen Gillan (The Big Short) as Nebula; and Sean Gunn (Gilmore Girls) as Kraglin . New cast members include PomKlementieff ( Oldboy ), Elizabeth Debicki (The Great Gatsby, Everest), Chris Sullivan (The Knick , The Drop) and Kurt Russell (The Hateful Eight, The Thing).
